articles.title: Wu Dawei Here
articles.content:
Wu Dawei Here
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Wu Dawei, special envoy of the Chinese government for the Affairs of the Korean Peninsula, and his party arrived here on Tuesday.

articles.title: Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception on Lunar New Year's Day
articles.content:
Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception on Lunar New Year's Day
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Li Jinjun, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception at his embassy here Tuesday on the occasion of the lunar New Year's Day, Juche 105 (2016).
					 Present at the reception on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health who doubles as chairman of the Central Committee of the Korea-China Friendship Society, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Staff members of the Chinese embassy were present there.
					
					 Li Jinjun said in his speech that last year the Korean people positively turned out in the struggle for developing economy and improving the people's living standards with joy of greeting the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and thus registered successes in various fields.
					
					 Saying that the historic 7th Congress of the WPK is to be held this year, he sincerely hoped that the congress would be successfully held and the Korean people register fresher and bigger successes in their works for ushering in a golden age in building a thriving nation under the leadership of the WPK headed by its First Secretary Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop referred to the fact that last year the Chinese people made successes in their works for realizing dream of China and splendidly greeted the 70th anniversaries of victory in their anti-Japanese war and the anti-fascist war of the world people.
					
					 He stressed that the Korean people are now making dynamic all-out onward campaign for ushering in a golden age in building a thriving nation this year when the 7th Congress of the WPK is to be held true to the militant tasks set forth by Marshal Kim Jong Un in his New Year address.

articles.title: Premier League Football Matches Begin in DPRK
articles.content:
Premier League Football Matches Begin in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Premier league football matches of the Paektusan Prize Sports Games began at the Sosan Football Stadium in Pyongyang on Monday.
					 Attending the league matches are 13 men's and 12 women's teams.
					
					 After the league matches, top four teams respectively from men's and women's teams will advance into the knock-out stage to be closed on February 25.
					
					 On Monday, the Amnokgang team beat the April 25 team 1:0 and the Ponghwasan team the Wolmido team 5:1 in the women's matches and the Kigwancha team defeated the Wolmido team 1:0 and the Pyongyang team the Sonbong team 2:1 in the men's matches.
					
					 According to an official of the football association, this year will witness premier league football matches on six occasions in total.

articles.title: Poster of 20th Kimjongilia Festival Produced
articles.content:
Poster of 20th Kimjongilia Festival Produced
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A poster of the 20th Kimjongilia Festival to be held on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il was produced.
					 Depicted in the center of the poster are Jong Il Peak covered with snow, Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secrete Camp and flowers in full bloom.
					
					 In its upper part are slogan "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be with us" and letters "The Day of the Shining Star" with the festival logo.
					
					 In its lower part are letters "The 20th Kimjongilia Festival" and festival venue and period.

articles.title: DPRK Pays Big Efforts to Wetland Protection
articles.content:
DPRK Pays Big Efforts to Wetland Protection
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- February 2 is World Wetland Day.
					 The UN stipulated that the theme of this year's wetland day is "Wetland for Our Future: Sustainable Livelihood".
					
					 In this regard, Kim Song Nam, vice-chairman of the C.C., the Nature Conservation Union of Korea, told KCNA that there are a number of rivers and lakes in Korea seabound on three sides.
					
					 He said:
					
					 The DPRK government has made big efforts to protect wetland resources and take sustainable use of them. As part of the efforts, reserves have been set in dozens of wetland across the country, including Mundok County, South Phyongan Province and Kumya County, South Hamgyong Province. And diverse activities have been pushed forward, which includes the ecological research into migratory birds in the west and east coastal areas, their stopover sites and habitats.
					
					 According to data available, at least 0.7 million longbills and one million water birds spend winter in the country.
					
					 For the protection of wetland resources, the DPRK government prohibits hunting and illegal economic development in wetland while paying primary attention to protecting animals in it.

articles.title: Intangible Heritages Newly Listed in DPRK
articles.content:
Intangible Heritages Newly Listed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Traditional embroidery, moxibustion and the making of rice-cake soup were listed as national intangible heritages, while the recipe for Pyongyang Onban (cooked rice served in chicken soup) was listed as one of local intangible heritages in the DPRK.
					 The Korean embroidery is well known at home and abroad for its long history and refinement.
					
					 Moxibustion, one of the Koryo therapies, makes it possible to cure incurable diseases by applying moxa to affected parts of human body.
					
					 Rice-cake soup is a special Korean dish for the Lunar New Year's Day.
					
					 Pyongyang Onban is known as one of four famous cuisines of Pyongyang.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Urges U.S. to Make Bold Decision on Rolling back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Urges U.S. to Make Bold Decision on Rolling back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Foreign politicians and media are now calling for the withdrawal of the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK while supporting the validity of the DPRK's access to nuclear weapons.
					 It was none other than the U.S. which produced nuclear weapons before any others and compelled the DPRK to have access to nuclear weapons, they said.
					
					 Kalashnikov, secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation who doubles as first vice-chairman of the International Affairs Committee of the State Duma, said in a talk to political and academic figures and experts aired by TV Tsentr of Russia on Jan. 22: "The DPRK's access to nuclear weapons was justifiable in the light of what happened in Iraq, Libya and Yugoslavia and it was the U.S. which has threatened the DPRK since the 1950s, compelling it to have access to nuclear weapons". 
					
					 Vorontsov, section chief for Korea and Mongolia of the Institute of Oriental Studies of the Russian Academy of Sciences, noted: "North Korea has neither bombed other countries nor tried to overturn their regimes. It is nonsensical to claim that such country poses a threat to the world. However, there exists, in actuality, an attempt to bring down the social system in north Korea."
					
					 The U.S. magazine National Interest on Jan. 20 asserted that the U.S. has to admit its negative policy on nuclear weapons which caused the DPRK to conduct four nuclear tests in the past decade.
					
					 Even forces in the U.S. mainland and its satellite countries are criticizing the present U.S. administration's north Korea policy, describing it as a completely failed one as it pushed the north to reinforcing its social system and having access to nuclear weapons.
					
					 The DPRK had access to self-defensive nuclear war deterrence in order to cope with the U.S. nuclear blackmail getting undisguised as the days go by.
					
					 It was entirely due to the U.S. anachronistic hostile policy towards the DPRK that it had access to nuclear weapons and the U.S.-DPRK relations have deteriorated.
					
					 Owing to the U.S. ever more undisguised nuclear threat and blackmail there is high likelihood of outbreak of a nuclear war due to an accidental case in the Korean Peninsula where the Armistice Agreement had been nullified.
					
					 Unless the U.S. rolls back its hostile policy towards the DPRK, the former's nuclear threat to the latter will persist and it will be left with no option but to take stronger measures one after another to bolster its nuclear deterrence both in quality and quantity.
					
					 The U.S. ruling quarters are entirely to blame for the situation prevailing in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to face up to the reality with cool head and make such a bold decision as rolling back its hostile policy towards the DPRK as early as possible.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Gun-related Crimes Festering in U.S. under Signboard of "Civilization"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Gun-related Crimes Festering in U.S. under Signboard of "Civilization"
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A Chinese woman on a running car was shot to death by a strange guy in Arizona State of the U.S.
					 People are killed for no reason in the U.S. owing to the gun-related crimes, but the incident is becoming a serious problem as the said-above victim is the Chinese studying in the U.S.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 What matters is that neither U.S. police responsible for ensuring social stability nor the government have solution to putting an end to the gun-related criminal acts of taking the lives of innocent people in broad daylight. This is the tragedy of the U.S. which styles itself "a human rights champion" in the international arena.
					
					 The successive rulers of the U.S. have painted their country as "a model of human rights and civilization", but the U.S. has become ever more degenerate and corrupt under the signboard of "civilization".
					
					 Americans, regardless of sex and age, unhesitatingly commit gun-related crimes, regarding violence as amusement and fun.
					
					 The more vocal people are becoming demanding control over guns, the more alarmingly markets are flooded with guns like commodities and the more frequently high-profile crimes of various kinds are taking place.
					
					 The U.N. made public that the U.S. tops the world's list in the murder rate.
					
					 It is nonsensical for the U.S. to talk about "civilization" and "human rights" as it has turned into a scene of horrible genocide.
					
					 Any visitor to the U.S. is required to put on a helmet and bulletproof jacket. Otherwise, it is hard to keep oneself alive there, adds the commentary.

articles.title: Japanese FM's Claim to Tok Islets Denounced
articles.content:
Japanese FM's Claim to Tok Islets Denounced
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Recently Japanese Foreign Minister Kishida at a full-dress session of the House of Representatives said "Tok Islets are part of the inviolable territory of Japan and its side would struggle for them to the last." 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' claim to Tok Islets is a revelation of their attempt to employ the same method as what they did at the negotiations with south Korea over the issue of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army in realizing their scenario to grab Tok Islets, upbeat over the south Korean authorities' sycophantic and humiliating stance. 
					
					 It is the calculation of the Japanese reactionaries that there will be no strong resistance to their efforts to push forward their scenario to grab Tok Islets now that they gagged the south Korean conservative ruling quarters in the course of settling the issue of sexual slavery to a certain measure. 
					
					 The war crimes of Japan including the crimes related to the sexual slavery can never be glossed over. They are not the matters to be settled by gagging the south Korean authorities only. 
					
					 The same is true of the issue of Tok Islets. 
					
					 Tok Islets are part of the inviolable territory of the Korean nation. The whole Korean nation has dominium over Tok Islets. 
					
					 The Koreans will never give up dominium over Tok Islets even though the islets may disappear due to many years' storms. 
					
					 No matter what sheer sophism the Japanese reactionaries may spout to grab Tok Islets in a bid to realize their scenario for territorial expansion, this would get them nowhere, the commentary warns.

articles.title: U.S. Policy of Military Confrontation Would Get It Nowhere: Minju Joson
articles.content:
U.S. Policy of Military Confrontation Would Get It Nowhere: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the U.S. Centre for Strategic and International Studies said in "Asia-Pacific Rebalance 2025" worked out at the request of the Pentagon that it is necessary to bolster up the missile defense capability in the Asia-Pacific region and discussed the deployment of THAAD in south Korea as one of the technical measures for it. Meanwhile, the U.S. military was reported to discuss in real earnest the issue of turning the ground for testing Aegis missile defense located in Hawaii into a base for exclusive use of missile defense.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday says that it is the calculation of the U.S. to put under its control the Asia-Pacific region of ever- increasing strategic significance at any cost and thus turn the world into the unipolar one dominated by it.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The Korean Peninsula is of important strategic value for the U.S. in carrying out its current Asia-Pacific rebalancing strategy for its geopolitical nature.
					
					 If the missile shield like THAAD is deployed in the Korean Peninsula, the U.S. can disable the strategic weapons of regional powers capable of challenging its strategic interests, to be precise Russia and China, hold military hegemony in the region and, furthermore, gain the possibility of establishing the U.S. dominating system in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 No country would remain a passive onlooker to the U.S. moves to seek military hegemony.
					
					 The rivals of the U.S. are bound to shape their strategies to achieve equilibrium of force in face of the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to roll back at once its foolish policy of military confrontation harmful not only to the interests of other countries but to its own security.

articles.title: Human Rights Abuses in S. Korea Denounced by Int'l Community
articles.content:
Human Rights Abuses in S. Korea Denounced by Int'l Community
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A special rapporteur of the UN called a press conference in Seoul on January 29 to make public the results of investigation into the human rights situation in south Korea. 
					 The results of intensive survey of human rights abuses in south Korea including the authorities' suppression of assemblies and demonstrations, restriction of the three labor rights, etc. made me feel that the freedom of assembly and association has stepped back in south Korea in recent years, the rapporteur said. 
					
					 The rapporteur expressed concern over the fact that the south Korean authorities are citing "security threat from north Korea" as a pretext for abridging the freedom of assembly and association. 
					
					 Conveying the news of the press conference, the south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People in an editorial on January 30 said that the results of the investigation were important as they were international community's observation and diagnosis of the present regime's unilateral revival of dictatorship. 
					
					 The editorial warned the authorities that if they persistently seek excuses, defying recommendations of the international organization, they will suffer international disgrace, leaving a serious stain.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Personages of Bangladesh, Colombia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Personages of Bangladesh, Colombia
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Seminars on exploits of leader Kim Jong Il took place in Bangladesh and Colombia on January 21 and 24 on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star (his birth anniversary).
					 Speakers including the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the president of the Bangladesh People's League, the chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee and the chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea praised Kim Jong Il for performing immortal ideological and theoretical exploits and Songun leadership exploits, saying that the Day of the Shining Star is a significant holiday common to the Korean people and the world progressive peoples.
					
					 They went on:
					
					 The DPRK emerged a political, ideological and military power and a fortress of the cause of independence against imperialism under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, encouraging the progressive people's struggle.
					
					 Kim Jong Il will be alive forever as the great sun of Songun, deeply revered by all people as he made great contribution to the cause of human independence.
					
					 The progressive media praised the DPRK for having access to H-bomb and expect that the U.S.-led imperialist forces would kneel down to the Korean people.
					
					 The president of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia said that Kim Jong Il left as a legacy the great exploit guaranteeing the eternal foundation of socialist Korea and its bright future.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Organization of DR Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Organization of DR Congo
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of DR Congo for celebrating the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star (the birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il) issued a bulletin on January 27 to mark the Day of the Shining Star.
					 The bulletin carried articles under the headline "On the occasion of the 74th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people, leader Kim Jong Il's idea and exploits will be immortal".
					
					 He was the greatest man who performed great exploits for the happiness of the Korean people and the accomplishment of the cause of human independence, it said, and went on:
					
					 He defended socialism, brought about an epochal phase of building a thriving nation and opened up a bright future of national reunification through his Songun leadership.
					
					 Today the service personnel and the people of the DPRK are turning out as one in the general offensive, true to the militant call for greeting the historic 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea as a golden age of revolution to be specially recorded in history.
					
					 The DPRK conducted successful first H-bomb test on January 6 this year.
					
					 The DPRK's first H-bomb test serves as a measure to firmly defend the sovereignty of the country and the vital rights of the nation and reliably guarantee peace in the Korean Peninsula and the security of the region from the daily-escalating nuclear threat and blackmail of the U.S.-led hostile forces.
					
					 The Korean people will successfully carry out the behests of Kim Jong Il under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Germany
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Germany
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed by the Federal Republic of Germany-DPRK Association on January 28.
					 Thomas Lichter, vice-chairman of the association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events to praise the sacred revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il and the greatness of Marshal Kim Jong Un between January 28 and February 16.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in South Africa
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in South Africa
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A South African preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Gauteng Province on January 28.
					 The secretary of the Gauteng Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold a meeting, seminar, lecture, film show and other colorful political and cultural events to praise the revolutionary careers and feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on the occasions of the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: DPRK's H-bomb Test Supported by Belarusian Organization
articles.content:
DPRK's H-bomb Test Supported by Belarusian Organization
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The National Social Federation "for the Union and Union's Communist Party" of Belarus issued a statement on January 8 as regards the DPRK's successful H-bomb test.
					 The statement condemned the imperialists for kicking up reckless racket against the DPRK over its H-bomb test for self-defense.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The U.S. is blocking other countries' efforts to have access to nuclear weapons. It is aimed to turn them into its complete colonies and annihilate those countries and peoples not obeying it.
					
					 It is natural that the DPRK attaches importance to its people's right to defend independence and advance along the road of socialism.
					
					 It is by no means accidental that the DPRK which is constantly being exposed to the nuclear threat has the right to manufacture such modern weapons.
					
					 The U.S. is the only imperialist country which used the nuclear weapons in the world.
					
					 The U.S., which is aimed to stifle the DPRK, is working to bolster up its armed forces and ignite a new nuclear war in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The statement called upon all progressive peoples in the world to send support and solidarity to the peace-loving DPRK firmly standing against the moves of the imperialist allied forces.

articles.title: DPRK's Self-Defensive Measure Supported by British Political Party
articles.content:
DPRK's Self-Defensive Measure Supported by British Political Party
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist) posted on its website an article titled "DPRK's right to defend itself and peace" on January 26.
					 When the DPRK succeeded in H-bomb test, the imperialists are kicking up a campaign against the DPRK in a bid to conceal their policy for aggression, the article said.
					
					 The DPRK's H-bomb test is a legitimate measure for defending itself and keeping peace from the imperialists' policy for bringing down its social system, it noted, and went on:
					
					 The UN lost the right to slander the DPRK's measure for self-defence as it has long been reduced to an organ shielding the imperialist aggression.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. which used nuclear weapons before any country and opened up the era of nuclear race.
					
					 It is natural for the DPRK to take a self-defensive measure to cope with the U.S. nuclear threat.
					
					 If the nuclear issue is to be settled, the U.S. should abandon its hostile policy toward the DPRK, withdraw its armed forces from south Korea and conclude a peace treaty with the DPRK.

articles.title: U.S. Journalist's Travelogue on DPRK Carried by Brazilian Newspaper
articles.content:
U.S. Journalist's Travelogue on DPRK Carried by Brazilian Newspaper
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian newspaper Patria Latina on January 20 carried a U.S. journalist's travelogue on the DPRK.
					 The newspaper illustrated the travelogue with photos showing public procession of Pyongyang citizens for celebrating the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the panoramic view of Pyongyang. It also carried an explanation that a U.S. journalist sets right false stories spread by Western media and clarifies legendary stories, truth and events stunning the West by visiting the DPRK.
					
					 The travelogue said:
					
					 Successes achieved by the DPRK in the free education, no homeless people, the pride and honor of the dignified people, etc. more vividly reflect the DPRK's appearance.
					
					 It is obvious that the West and the U.S. do not know well about the DPRK.
					
					 They have never mentioned the DPRK's issues and the fact that it is exposed to the threat from big powers, in particular.
					
					 Let's suppose the DPRK conducts war exercises in U.S. coastal waters every year in order to occupy the U.S.
					
					 Will the U.S. not think about developing nuclear weapons to cope with such a situation?
					
					 Koreans do not pursue a war.
					
					 When watching the destiny of Libya, they are sure that the Songun politics and nuclear deterrent help firmly defend the sovereignty of the country. 
					
					 I sincerely advise the West to improve the relations with the DPRK.
					
					 As a matter of fact, whoever had a chance to visit the DPRK is surprised to know what he or she experienced there is completely different from what one had thought of it.

articles.title: En Pyongyang delegado especial de gobierno chino para problema de Peninsula Coreana
articles.content:
En Pyongyang delegado especial de gobierno chino para problema de Peninsula Coreana 
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ACNC) -- Llegaron el dia 2 a esta capital el delegado especial del gobierno chino para el problema de la Peninsula Coreana, Wu Dawei, y su comitiva.

articles.title: EE.UU. debe tomar decision de abandonar politica hostil anti-RPDC, comenta ACNC
articles.content:
EE.UU. debe tomar decision de abandonar politica hostil anti-RPDC, comenta ACNC
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ACNC) -- En la actualidad, los politicos y medios de prensa de varios paises afirman la justeza de la posesion de armas nucleares de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y exigen a Estados Unidos retirar la politica hostil anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Insisten en que EE.UU. es el primer pais que produjo armas nucleares y el autor que hizo a la RPDC tomar la decision de poseer esos artefactos.
					
					Una television rusa proyecto el dia 22 de enero la entrevista con las personalidades de los circulos politico y cientifico y los especialistas, en la que el secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de la Federacion Rusa y primer vicepresidente del Comite de Asuntos Internacionales de la Duma Estatal de Rusia, Kalashnikov, dijo: "Al tomar en consideracion el destino de Irak, Libia y Yugoslavia, resulta justa la posesion de armas nucleares de la RPDC. Esta se vio obligada a poseer las armas nucleares para hacer frente a la amenaza de EE.UU., iniciada desde la decada de 1950."
					
					Alexandr Vorontsov, jefe de seccion de Corea y Mongolia del Instituto de Estudios del Oriente de la Academia de Ciencias de Rusia dijo que "Corea del Norte (RPDC) nunca bombardeo a ningun pais ni intento el derrumbe del Poder de otros. Es muy absurda la sofisteria sobre la amenaza de este pais al mundo. Sin embargo, si existe realmente el intento de derrumbe del regimen contra Corea del Norte."
					
					La revista norteamericana de relaciones internacionales National Interest insistio en su edicion del dia 20 de enero en que EE.UU. debe reconocer que su politica injusta sobre armas nucleares produjo las 4 pruebas nucleares de la RPDC efectuadas durante 10 anos pasados.
					
					No solo en EE.UU., sino en sus satelites, se escuchan las criticas severas de que la politica hostil anti-RPDC de la administracion norteamericana es "la politica totalmente fracasada que empujo al Norte (RPDC) al fortalecimiento del sistema y la posesion de armas nucleares.".
					
					Como muestran las opiniones publicas, EE.UU. es precisamente el autor que impulso la RPDC a la posesion de armas nucleares.
					
					El  disuasivo autodefensivo de guerra nuclear de la RPDC es, de rabo a cabo, para enfrentar con las amenazas cada vez mas abiertas del imperio.
					
					La posesion de armas nucleares de RPDC y el empeoramiento de relaciones RPDC-EE.UU. se deben a EE.UU. que ha venido practicando la anacronica politica hostil.
					
					Actualmente, existe gran probabilidad de estallar la guerra nuclear por los elementos casuales en la Peninsula Coreana donde fue invalidado el Acuerdo de Armisticio debido a las amenazas nucleares de EE.UU. que se tornan mas abiertas dia por dia.
					
					Mientras EE.UU. no abandona su politica hostil, se continuara la amenaza nuclear contra la RPDC y se seguiran tomandose las medidas mas intensas de esta para fortalecer de manera cualitativa y cuantitativa su disuasivo nuclear.
					
					La capa dominante norteamericana tiene la responsabilidad total de la actual situacion creada en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					EE.UU. debe ver con seriedad la realidad y tomar de inmediato la decision de anular de manera radical la politica hostil contra la RPDC.
